intro: Secamone occidentalis, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
